turns.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
turns.text: I think you have the wrong number.

turns.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
turns.text: Yeah.  You have the wrong number. There's no one named Frank here.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: That's fine.  It's nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Are we gonna tape some stuff now?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: If you're up to it, I've got us set up in a suite upstairs --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You got us a room so quick?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: All it takes is one second?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Just one look, one hesitation, one subtle gesture for me to know -- And Bing-Bam-Boom I'm away on a tangent -- I get so fuckin' amped at these seminars and lemme tell you why: Because I Am What I Believe. I am what I teach, I do as I say, I live by these rules as religiously as I preach them: And you wanna know what? I'm gettin' pussy left, right, up, down, center and sideways.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: -- go, go, go.  I'm givin' pearls here. And I'II tell you samethin' else: I'm not succeding in the bush because I'm Frank TJ Mackey.  If anything, there are women out there that want to <u>destroy</u> me -- it makes it twice as hard for me, I run into some little muffin, knows who I am, knows my schemes and plans -- shit, she's gonna wanna fuck around, prove to her friends, say, "Yaddda-yadda-yadda, I saw that guy, he wasn't anything, didn't get me."  So me? I'm runnin' on full throttle the whole fuckin' time.  Dodging bullets left and right from terrorist blonde beauties. But I'II tell you this: The battle of the bush is being fought and won by Team Mackey.  Can I have a cigarette?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: Ok.  So, lemme just ask you a couple questions to start --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: -- see, I thought you grew up here in the valley --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: -- that's right, that's right, and what I'M saying, that none of my competitors can say is this:  That there is no need for insight or understanding.  Things of the past! Gone, Over, Done. Do you realize how fucking miraculous this is? How fucking razor sharp and cutting edge and ahead of it's time this concept is?  I'm talking about eliminating <u>insight</u> and <u>understanding</u> as human values.  GOD DAMN I'M GOOD.  There is no need for INSIGHT.  There is no need for UNDERSTANDING.  I have found a way to take <u>any</u> subjective human experience -- in other words -- all the terrible shit or all the great shit that you've had happen to you in your life -- and quickly and easily transform it in the unconscious mind through the subtle and cunning use of language.  The "listener-patient"  settles into a very light, very delicate, conversationally induced state: NOT A TRANCE, mind you, but a STATE. A state that is brand new.  The System's state. What did I do?  I REALIZED that concept and put it into practical "get my dick hard and fuck it" use. I'm gonna build a state for the seducer and the seducee to live, vote, breath, pay takes and party 'till dawn.  I'm gonna teach methods of language that will help anyone get a piece of ass, tit and tail --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I just realized this is for television, isn't it?  I can't swear up and down like I just did.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: It's fine.  I can bleep it out.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I warned you -- I get on a roll...

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: -- let's talk more about your background --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: I'm confused about your past is the thing.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: I would just want to clear some things up:

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Thank you, Muffy.  Funny thing is: This is an important element of, "Seduce and Destory:" "Facing the past is an important way in not making progress," that's something I tell my men over and over --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: -- and I try and teach the students to ask: What is it in aid of?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: Well, just trying to figure out who you are, and how you might have become --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: I'm saying, Frank, in trying to figure out who you are --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: -- there's a lot more important things I'd like to put myself <u>into</u> --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: It's not like I'm trying to attack you --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: This is how you wanna spend the time, then go, go, go -- you're gonna be surprised at what a waste it is -- "The most useless thing in the world is that which is behind me," Chapter Three --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: We talked earlier about your mother. And we talked about your father and his death. And I don't want to be challenging or defeatist here, but I have to ask and I would want to clarify something -- something that I understand --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm not sure I hear a question in there?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: Do you remember a Miss Simms?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I know alotta women and I'm sure she remembers me.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: She does.  From when you were a boy.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: An old stomping ground --is this the "attack" portion of the interview, I figured this was coming sooner or later -- Is "the girl" coming in for the kill?

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: No, this is about getting something right and claryfying one of your answers to an earlier question --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Go ahead and waste your time.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: I was told that your mother died. That your mother died when you were young --

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: I talked to Miss Simms.  Miss Simms was your caretaker and neighbor after your mother died in 1980.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: C'mon, Frank.  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Time's up.  Thank you for the interview.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: So you sat it out, that's what you did?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You requested my time and I gave it you, you called me a liar and made accusations. And you say, "If I'd known I wouldn't have asked," then it's not an attack?  Well, I don't wanna be the sort of fella who doesn't keep his word.  I gave you my time, Bitch. So fuck you now.

turns.speaker: GWENOVIER
turns.text: You're hurting a lot of people, Frank --

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: And what did your parents do?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: My father worked in televison. My mother -- this is gonna sound silly to you -- she was a librarian.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: What does she say about, "Seduce and Destroy."

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: And you ended up at UC Berkely --

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: And you went to Van Nuys High, right?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I don't how much I went -- but I was enrolled.  I was such a loser back then. I was -- misguided, pathetic -- I was very fat. Not even close to what I am today. Not the Frank TJ Mackey you're eager to talk to because I was swimming in what <u>was</u> as opposed to I <u>wanted</u>.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Where does that name come from?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: It's not your given name, right?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: My mother's name, actually. Good question.  You've done you're research.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Ok.  That's why.  I had trouble locating your school records at Berkely and UCLA. Your name change -- they had no official enrollment --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  No, no, no.  They wouldn't --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: no, no, no.  Certainly not.  I wasn't officialy enrolled, that's right. Was that unclear?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I wouldn't want that to be misunderstood: My enrollment was totally unoffical because I was, sadly, unable to afford tuition up there.  But there were three wonderful men who were kind enough to let me sit in on their classes, and they're names are: Macready, Horn and Langtree among others. I was completely independent financially, and like I said: One Sad Sack A Shit. So what we're looking at here is a true rags to riches story and I think that's what most people respond to in "Seduce," And At The End Of The Day? Hey -- it may not even be about picking up chicks and sticking your cock in it -- it's about finding What You Can Be In This World.  Defining It.  Controling It and saying: I will take what is mine.  You just happen to get a blow job out of it, then hey-what-the-fuck- why-not?  he.he.he.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Are you asking me a question?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Well I guess the question is this: Do you remember Miss Simms?

turns.text: Yeah. I was trying to get in touch with you.  We got dissconnected.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I got your message.  That you were trying to get me -- right?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Yes.  I didn't know how to find you. Earl asked me, so I looked through the adress books and there was no number, nothing --

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: She's not here, she went out. I'm sorry.  This is all just so, I don't know what, what to do -- your Dad asked me to try and track you down. To get you and I did, I called the number -- Do you wanna come in?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: These Dogs'll calm down -- you just have to come in --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Let's just wait one minute and stay here, okay?

turns.text: How long have you taken care of him?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: For six months.  I'm the day nurse...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: He's...I'm sorry...so sorry...I've seen this before, you know and you don't.... He's going very fast....Frank...um....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I just...he was...but I gave him, I just had to give him a small dose of liquid morphine.  He hasn't been able to swallow the morphine pills so we now, I just had to go to the liquid morphine... For the pain, you understand?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Um...soon tonight...I think, yes? Tommorrow...I mean...very soon...very...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: When did he go off chemo?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: .....have you ever seen this..I mean, never mind, you said --

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I work as a nurse, for a proffesion --

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I've heard your tapes on the phone.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: When they put me on hold, to talk to you...they play the tapes. I mean: I'd seen the commercials and heard about you, but I'd never heard the tapes ....

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: So....Phil....um...I think I'm gonna step in and try and see him and say something if he can...talk...I mean:

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Can you stand...back...maybe, I mean... just a little bit...in the room is ok, but back from us a little...

turns.text: I'm here.  I'm here now.  What do you want? Do you want anything?

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: You can't just come in here.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: The door was open, I got a call --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: I got a call to this apartment, report of a disturbance --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: I got a call of a disturbance, you're door was open, I just wanna see what's goin' on --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Then you've got nothin' to worry about.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: You don't tell me, I know my rights, just come right in, you can't --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Don't test me, you wanna talk about what the law book says, we can do that, push me far enough and I'll take you to jail -- now calm down.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: You're not calm.  You're screamin' and yellin' and I'm here to check on a disturbance that was reported and that's what I'm gonna do - now are you alone in here?

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I don't have to answer your questions.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: No you don't: But I'm gonna ask you one more time: Are you alone in here?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: OK.  That's true.  Is anyone else, besides me and besides you in this house?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Maybe so, but I'm gonna ask you one more time: Is Anyone Else In This House Right Now?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Ok. Marice why don't you take a seat for me?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Maybe you didn't, but I'm here to find out about a disturbance. Some neighbors called said they heard screaming and a loud crash.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I don't know a loud crash.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I said: I DON'T KNOW.  You can't just come in here and start pokin' around --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: What's this, how did this happen?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: You just woke up.  And what'd you have a party last night, the way this place looks?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Ok. Marcie. Starting now I want you to have a new attitude with me.  The more you play games, the more suspicious I'm gonna become that you've been up to something.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: It's a free country, you can think anything you want.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Yes I can, Marcie.  And until you start givin' me some straight answers: I'm gonna assume that some mischief has been goin' on here.

turns.text: Mischief?  What the fuck you talkin' about, mischief?

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Bad and illegal behavior. That's what I mean. Ok?  Mischief.  Now have you been doin' some drugs today?

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: It's ten o'clock in the morning --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: No. No. Stay down, Marcie, sit back down on that couch --

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I don't have to do a god damn thing.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: WHAT'S THIS? WHAT'S THIS? GOD DAMN BULLSHIT. BULLSHIT. DON'T PUT THOSE --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Marcie - CALM DOWN. CALM DOWN and don't do this. I want you to stay --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: This is the LAPD. If anyone is back here I want you to come out and I want you to show yourself to me with your hands in the air --

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: THERE'S NO ONE IN THERE. STAY OUT OF MY MOTHERFUCKIN BEDROOM.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: This is the LAPD, if anyone is in the closet I want you to come out and show yourself to me, slowly and with your hands up --

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: Marcie - quiet down! Now if anyone is in the closet, come out now --

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: THERE'S NO ONE IN MY MOTHERFUCKIN CLOSET AND STAY OUT OF MY BEDROOM, STAY OUT OF MY GOD DAMN BEDROOM.

turns.speaker: JIM KURRING
turns.text: -- do not do this -- my gun is drawn and If I Have To Open That Closet you will get shot -- Step Out Now.

turns.text: What the hell is this Marcie?

turns.text: What the fuck is this, Jimmy?

turns.text: If she asks me any question I want to tell her.  I want to tell her everything I've done.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Come and tell me it's over and I'll walk away, Jimmy.  I've fucked you behind your wife's back for three years, and you've fucked teenage girls behind mine for the same amount of time -- I'll walk away, you need something for your life, for your conscience, but don't put me in the middle --

turns.text: I got in trouble at school.

turns.text: Rose is on the phone and here's the cards for today --

turns.text: I need you to get me Paula --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yes. Now. Find her. She's somewhere in the building --

turns.text: We're on the air in twenty minutes, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Find her, get her and tell her I want to talk to her, Mary.  Fucking hell.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Fuck.  I think I'm gonna throw up, I think.  I haven't thrown up since I was twenty years old.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: For 25.  Best known for the "tragedy and blood" genre, this author-playwright --

turns.text: I'm gonna need a full name, Stanley.

turns.text: I was saying...thinking maybe I'd get my own quiz show someday, Jimmy. Just like you!

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: We are not on display.  I am not a doll. I AM NOT A DOLL...I' M NOT SILLY AND CUTE. I'M SMART SO THAT SHOULDN'T MAKE ME SOMETHING, SOMETHING SO PEOPLE CAN WATCH HOW SILLY IT IS THAT HE'S SMART?  I KNOW.  I KNOW THINGS. I KNOW. I HAVE TO GO TO THE BATHROOM I HAVE TO GO TO THE BATHROOM AND I HAVE TO GO.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I don't mean to cry, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Come home soon after the show.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I went to see her -- some fuckin' asshole answers the door in his underwear, he's fifty years old, there's coke and shit laid out on the table --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: She went crazy.  She went crazy, Rose.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't know.  I have to go, I don't have time and I have more drinking to do before I go march --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't think I want that.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How do we do this, then?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: We just do it...we do it and we figure it out and we do as we do, I guess...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No, I mean:  I'm telling you this, now. You see?  You see I want to make everything clear and clean...and apologize for me....for all the stupid things I've done....that will eat me up....

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You feel like you want to be forgiven for your sins?  Honey, you're not on your death bed, yet....this kinda talk's gonna get you in trouble --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: --- don't.  don't.  Please.  Just... listen to me...honey....  ...I've done...I've cheated on you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: ...No...I don't hate you.  Do you want talk...do you really want to talk to me and say things and get things figured out, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: The question isn't wether or not you cheated on me, the question is how many times have you cheated on me?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How many times....it's ok...just say... Just say...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't even remember...many...twenty... maybe more...not much more...twenty times.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't hate you, Jimmy.  But I have a couple questions that I wanna ask....

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No one else that I know?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's over.  I talked to her this morning.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's over becuase...for all the the right reasons I hope, what I said.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Do you have any children with anyone?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Do you feel better now that you've said this?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not mad.  I am, but I'm not.  Y'know?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not through asking my questions.

turns.text: Why doesn't Claudia talk to you, Jimmy?

turns.text: Why, well I think we've, we both don't know...what do you mean?

turns.text: Do you know the answer to this?

turns.text: I'm asking you.  I'm asking you if you know why Clauida will not speak to you....please, Jimmy....tell me.

turns.text: I think that she thinks I may have molested her.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: She thinks terrible things that somehow got in her head...that I might have done something.  She said that to me last time...when it was...ten years ago she walked out the door, "You touched me wrong..." "I know that." Some crazy thought in her, in her head...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes you do....you do and you won't say.

turns.speaker: ROSE

turns.text: I don't know what I've done.

turns.text: I don't know what I've done.

turns.text: Yeah.  She's sleeping now, I mean --

turns.text: Do you still have to do homework?

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: -- I have something to tell you. I have to tell you something. I want to change his will, can I change his will?...I need to ---

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: You can't change his will.  Only Earl can change his will.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: No, no....no, you see...I never loved him. I never loved him, Earl.  When I started, when I met him, I met him and I fucked him and I married him because I wanted his money, do you understand?  I'm telling you this now...this I've never told anyone...I didn't love him. And now....I know I'm in that will, I know, I was there with him, we were all there together when we made that fucking thing and all the money I'II get -- I don't want it -- Because I love him so much now...I've fallen in love with him now, for real, as he's dying, and I look at him and he's about to go, Alan, he's dead...he's moments...  I took care of him through this, Alan. And What Now Then?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I don't want him to die, I didn't love him when we met, and I've done so many bad things to him that he doesn't know, things I want to confess to him, but now I do: I love him. I love him so much and I can't stand -- he's going.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: What kind of medication are you on right now, Linda that's --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: This is not any fucking medication talking, this isn't -- I don't know. I don't know -- Can you give me nothing? You have power of attorney, can you see him, can you, in this final fucking moment, go see him and make sure --- change the fucking will -- I don't want any money, I couldn't live with myself, this thing I've done -- I've fucking done so many bad things -- I fucked around.  I fucked around on him, I fucking cheated on him, Alan. You're his lawyer, our laywer, THERE, I'm his wife, we are married. I broke the conract of marriage, I fucking cheated on him, many times over, I sucked other men's cocks and fuck - fuck - fuck - ....fuck.... Other Things I've Done..

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: Adultery isn't illegal -- it's not something that can be used in a court to discredit the will or -- Linda. Linda. Calm down.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: You don't have to change the will, if what you want to do is get nothing you can renounce the will when it's time.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: Well.  Considering that there's no one else mentioned in the will...we'd have to go to the laws of intestacy, which is -- as if someone died without a will --

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: The money would go to Frank.  The court would put the money in the hands of a relative --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: -- that can't happen.  Earl doesn't want him to have the money, the things.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: -- unless Frank is specifically ommitted as a beneficiary that's what will happen.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: This is so over-the-top and fucked-up I can hardly stand it.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: Linda, you just have to take a moment and breath and one thing at a time --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Shut the fuck up. Shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Now you must really shut the fuck up, please. Shut The Fuck Up.

turns.speaker: KLIGMAN
turns.text: Let me call you a car, Linda.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I've got Frank...Frank Earl's son. He's...he asked me to get him and I did --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: PUT THE FUCKIN' PHONE DOWN, HANG IT UP.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You don't do that, you don't call him, you don't know to get involved in the bussiness of his, of his of <u>my</u> family. this is the <u>family</u>, <u>me</u> and <u>him</u> do you understand?  You understand? NO ONE ELSE. THERE IS NO ONE ELSE.  That man, his son does not exist.  HE IS DEAD.  HE IS DEAD and WHO TOLD YOU TO DO THAT?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Earl asked me, Linda, please, Linda, I'm sorry -- Earl asked me --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: BULLSHIT. BULLSHIT HE DIDN'T ASK YOU, HE DOESN'T WANT HIM, HE DOESN'T WANT TO TALK TO HIM, SO FUCK YOU THAT HE ASKED THAT. THERE IS NO ONE BUT ME AND HIM.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: listen...listen to me now, Phil: I'm sorry, sorry I slapped your face. ...because I don't know what I'm doing... ...I don't know how to do this, y'know? You understand?  y'know?  I...I'm...I do things and I fuck up and I fucked up....forgive me, ok? Can you just...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Tell him I'm sorry, ok, yes, you do that, now, I'm sorry, tell him, for all the things I've done...I fucked up and I'm sorry.... And I'm Gonna Turn Away And Walk Now And Not Look At Him Not See My Man, My Earl, I'll leave now...and tell him it's ok and I'm ok. The whole thing was ok with me -- and I know.

turns.speaker: YOUNG PHARMACY KID
turns.text: Cats and Dogs out there, huh?

turns.speaker: YOUNG PHARMACY KID
turns.text: Must have alot goin' on for all that stuff you got back there, eh?  You could have quite a party all that stuff....

turns.speaker: YOUNG PHARMACY KID
turns.text: You been on Prozac long?  Dexadrine?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You motherfucker...you motherfucker.... YOU FUCKING ASSHOLE, WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU? WHO THE FUCK DO YOU THINK YOU ARE?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I COME IN HERE - YOU DON'T KNOW, YOU DON'T KNOW WHO THE FUCK I AM OR WHAT MY LIFE IS AND YOU HAVE THE FUCKING BALLS, THE <u>INDECENCY</u> TO ASK ME A QUESTION ABOUT MY LIFE --

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Hi. I'd like to get an order for delivery.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'd like to get an order of...um...peanut butter.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Um, no, y'know what? Forget the water, just give me a loaf of bread...white bread.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: And um....do you have Swank magazine?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Ok. One of those. Do you have Ram Rod? The magazine, Ram Rod?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Ok. One of those.  And...um...Barely Legal?

turns.speaker: PINK DOT GIRL
turns.text: yeah, I said.  Is that it?

turns.speaker: PINK DOT GIRL
turns.text: Do you still want the peanut butter, bread and cigarettes ?

turns.speaker: PINK DOT GIRL
turns.text: Total is $15.29.  Thirty minutes or less.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I don't have regular classes anymore.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: They just let me have my own study-time, my own reading time in the library.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What are they gonna do -- beat us?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: The fuck is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I gotta go to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Did you piss your fuckin' pants, Stanley?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I don't wanna go, I can't do it this time.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: -- the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Stanley if you don't fuckin' stand up and go over there I'm gonna beat your ass --

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I'm sick of being the one, the one who always has to do everything, I don't want to be the one always --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Let's go,let's go, let's go, you shoulda done that ten minutes ago --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- talk in the car, talk in the car, moves your ass, c'mon --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Why the hell do you need all four bags of books to go to school each day?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I can't carry all of them. I need them. I need my books. I need them to go to school.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I got an audition, I won't make it here 'till two, c'mon, I'll see you later. Love you.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: -- I didn't see you from the window.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What's the problem, what's the problem here?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Why didn't you answer those questions?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Bullshit.  Bullshit. You know the answer to every goddamn question and I knew the answer to those questions and I'm not half as smart as you are so What Happened?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I didn't I'm fine, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I'm fine. I'm fine, I just wanna keep playing --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Are we gonna keep going with this game?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're two fuckin' days from the record, get through this and I'II do anything for you, you just gotta get through this --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: hang in there, ok. I love you.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: You have to be nicer to me, Dad.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I think that you have to be nicer to me.

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: ....you have it...easy....you know? You have a father who loves you, huh?

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: You know what it's like to come home scared, scared that maybe if you don't have the money you're supposed to go out each day and get that you're gonna get beaten....by a belt...he hits me with a belt, Stanley....  I'm supposed to sell those candy bars, and if I don't, I come home without the money....

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: Cause he hates me....he hates me so much.

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: I'm sorry to put all this on you, Stanley --

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I have money to give you.

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: No.  No.  I have to do this on my own.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I can take you to get money.  I don't need it...I don't <u>need</u> it -- listen to me: I can let you have money so your father won't hit you ever again -- you'll have the money because I don't need it.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: It's raining frogs from the sky.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: This happens....this is something that happens.

turns.speaker: WORM
turns.text: What the fuck is goin' on, WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I understand you saved my son's life today.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: M'lady... if anyone sees, it is death...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: If I don't kiss you, I die anyway.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I can't bear to see you cry.  What is wrong?
